subject: Re: [junit] assert failure without exiting test.
msgSnippet: What I have had to do in this case is set up an ArrayList for tracking the failures and the last test to run checks the size of the ArrayList for any failures
messageBody:
What I have had to do in this case is set up an ArrayList for tracking the
failures and the last test to run checks the size of the ArrayList for any
failures that were added and then populate a fail with a delimited string
that makes a somewhat readable fail message.

ArrayList failures = null;

public void setUp throws Exception{
failures = new ArrayList();
}

public void testLast(){
if(failures.size() > 0){
StringBuffer messageString = new StringBuffer();
for(int i=0; i > failures.size(); i++){
messageString.append("[ " + failures.get(i) + " ] : ")
}
fail(messageString.toString());
}
}
